ground_truth: A crash occurs, with the object hitting the Earth some distance away, producing noises from inside the damaged carriage as if an angry beast is trapped. On the remains of the platform, the Cinay camera runs out of film, while the largely intact yellow Coupe remains amid the devastation. Joe navigates past the car in search of the others, climbing onto twisted railway tracks where he sees Preston and gives a thumbs up. Joe notices a blood stain and walks toward it, with the others gathering around. Alice appears behind them, prompting a smile from Joe, who then turns back to the wreckage, retrieves his makeup box, and quickly pockets a locket Alice notices. He picks up a strange white cube from the wreckage before joining the others on top of a wrecked carriage, offering a view across the devastation. Joe points to the mangled remains of a white pickup truck. They descend from the carriage and approach the pickup, where a man sits unresponsive. Alice touches his limp arm, causing a document to spill from his hand, which she picks up and opens as the boys crowd around. It's a map that Dr. Woodward seizes, sitting up stiffly and looking around at the kids before pulling out a revolver as people approach. The kids flee, with Alice running to the Coupe, and the boys collecting their belongings, including the camera, before scrambling into the car. Alice drives them away as numerous soldiers arrive, brandishing guns and torches, with one soldier picking up a discarded Super 8 film box and pondering it. Back in town, the boys exit the car as Alice hands Joe the white cube he retrieved from the crash site. With faces grimed from explosions, Alice and Joe regard each other briefly before Alice drives away in the Coupe, watched by Joe and the others. At home, Joe sits in the bath, holding the knobbly-surfaced white cube, staring thoughtfully into the distance as the town's lights twinkle in the darkness from a hillside view. The next morning, Joe is seen sleeping in bed and later puts out dog food before running to the Kaznyk's house, script in hand, to join Charles, who is watching TV.

test_cases.name: Synonym Substitution
test_cases.description: A collision happens, with the item striking the Earth some distance away, generating sounds from inside the impaired carriage as if a furious creature is confined. On the ruins of the platform, the Cinay camera runs out of film, while the mostly undamaged yellow Coupe stays amid the destruction. Joe maneuvers past the automobile in quest of the others, ascending onto distorted railway rails where he observes Preston and gives a thumbs up. Joe detects a blood smear and strolls toward it, with the others assembling around. Alice emerges behind them, prompting a smile from Joe, who then turns back to the debris, retrieves his makeup container, and swiftly pockets a locket Alice observes. He picks up a peculiar white block from the debris before joining the others atop a ruined carriage, offering a view across the destruction. Joe gestures to the mangled ruins of a white pickup truck. They descend from the carriage and approach the pickup, where a man sits unreactive. Alice touches his limp arm, causing a document to spill from his hand, which she picks up and opens as the boys crowd around. It's a chart that Dr. Woodward seizes, sitting up rigidly and looking around at the kids before pulling out a revolver as people approach. The kids flee, with Alice running to the Coupe, and the boys gathering their belongings, including the camera, before scrambling into the car. Alice drives them away as numerous soldiers arrive, brandishing firearms and torches, with one soldier picking up a discarded Super 8 film container and contemplating it. Back in town, the boys exit the car as Alice hands Joe the white block he retrieved from the crash location. With faces grimed from detonations, Alice and Joe regard each other briefly before Alice drives away in the Coupe, watched by Joe and the others. At home, Joe sits in the bath, holding the knobbly-surfaced white block, staring thoughtfully into the distance as the town's lights glimmer in the darkness from a hillside view. The next morning, Joe is seen sleeping in bed and later puts out dog food before running to the Kaznyk's house, script in hand, to join Charles, who is watching TV.

test_cases.name: Active <-> Passive Transformation
test_cases.description: A crash is heard, with the Earth being hit by the object some distance away, and noises are produced from inside the damaged carriage as if an angry beast is trapped. On the remains of the platform, film runs out in the Cinay camera, while the largely intact yellow Coupe is left amid the devastation. The car is navigated past by Joe in search of the others, and he climbs onto twisted railway tracks where Preston is seen by him, and a thumbs-up is given. A blood stain is noticed by Joe, and he walks toward it, with the others gathering around. Alice is seen appearing behind them, prompting a smile to be given by Joe, who then turns back to the wreckage, retrieves his makeup box, and quickly pockets a locket that is noticed by Alice. A strange white cube is picked up by him from the wreckage before he joins the others on top of a wrecked carriage, offering a view across the devastation. Joe points out the mangled remains of a white pickup truck. They descend from the carriage and approach the pickup, where a man is sitting unresponsive. His limp arm is touched by Alice, causing a document to be spilled from his hand, which she picks up and opens as the boys crowd around. Dr. Woodward seizes it—it’s a map—and he sits up stiffly, looking around at the kids before he pulls out a revolver as people approach. The kids flee, and Alice runs to the Coupe, while the boys collect their belongings, including the camera, before they scramble into the car. They are driven away by Alice as numerous soldiers arrive, brandishing guns and torches, with one soldier picking up a discarded Super 8 film box to ponder it. Back in town, the car is exited by the boys as Joe is handed the white cube he retrieved from the crash site by Alice. With faces grimed from explosions, Alice and Joe regard each other briefly before the Coupe is driven away by Alice, watched by Joe and the others. At home, the bath is sat in by Joe, holding the knobbly-surfaced white cube, staring thoughtfully into the distance as the town's lights twinkle in the darkness from a hillside view. The next morning, Joe sleeps in bed and later puts out dog food before the Kaznyk's house is run to by him, script in hand, to join Charles, who is watching TV.

test_cases.name: Brevity - L1
test_cases.description: A crash occurs with the object hitting the Earth some distance away, causing noises from inside the wrecked carriage as if a trapped beast is inside. The Cinay camera runs out of film, while the largely intact yellow Coupe stands amid the destruction. Joe navigates past the car, climbs onto twisted railway tracks where he sees Preston and gives a thumbs up. Joe notices a blood stain and approaches it as others gather. Alice appears, prompting Joe to smile before turning back to the wreckage to retrieve his makeup box and pocket a locket Alice sees. He picks up a strange white cube before joining the others atop a wrecked carriage, offering a wide view of the devastation. Joe points to a mangled white pickup truck. They descend and approach the pickup where an unresponsive man sits. Alice touches his limp arm, causing a document to spill out, which she picks up. It's a map Dr. Woodward seizes, sitting up and pulling out a revolver as people approach. The kids flee, Alice runs to the Coupe, and the boys gather their belongings, including the camera, before scrambling into the car. Alice drives them away as soldiers arrive with guns and torches, one soldier pondering a Super 8 film box. In town, the boys exit the car as Alice hands Joe the white cube. Grimed from explosions, Alice and Joe briefly exchange glances before she drives away in the Coupe, watched by Joe and the others. At home, Joe sits in the bath, holding the knobbly white cube, staring thoughtfully as the town’s lights twinkle in the darkness. The next morning, Joe sleeps in bed, later puts out dog food, and runs to the Kaznyk’s house, script in hand, to join Charles, who is watching TV.

test_cases.name: Brevity - L2
test_cases.description: A crash occurs, with the object hitting Earth at a distance and noises emerging from the damaged carriage like a trapped beast. On the platform, the Cinay camera runs out of film, while a yellow Coupe lies amid the wreckage. Joe moves past the car, climbs twisted tracks, spots Preston, and gives a thumbs up. He notices a blood stain and approaches it as others gather. Alice appears, Joe smiles, retrieves his makeup box, pockets a locket Alice sees, and picks up a white cube from the wreckage. They climb a carriage, observing the devastation, and Joe points to a mangled white pickup. They approach the unresponsive man inside, Alice touches his arm, a document falls, which she opens—a map Dr. Woodward seizes before drawing a revolver as people near. The kids flee, with Alice driving them in the Coupe, taking their belongings, including the camera. Soldiers arrive, one picking up a Super 8 film box thoughtfully. In town, Alice hands Joe the white cube. They look at each other briefly before Alice drives away. At home, Joe sits in the bath, holding the white cube and staring into the distance as the town's lights twinkle. The next morning, Joe sleeps, feeds his dog, and runs to the Kaznyk's house with a script to join Charles watching TV.

test_cases.name: Verbosity - L1
test_cases.description: A sudden, intense crash unfolds as an object makes a violent impact with the Earth's surface some distance away, creating a cacophony of noises emanating from within the battered, damaged carriage. It's as if an angry, ferocious beast finds itself trapped inside. Over on the remnants of the platform, the Cinay camera, while capturing the aftermath, exhausts its film supply. Meanwhile, amidst the widespread devastation, a predominantly intact yellow Coupe remains steadfast in the chaos. Joe skillfully navigates around the car, intent on locating the others, as he climbs onto the twisted, contorted railway tracks. Here, he spots Preston and communicates a silent greeting with a thumbs up gesture. His attention is drawn to a bloodstain, prompting him to walk in that direction, with the others gradually gathering around him. Alice suddenly appears from behind, causing Joe to smile warmly before he shifts his focus back to the wreckage. From the debris, he retrieves his treasured makeup box, quickly tucking away a locket that Alice happens to notice. Additionally, he picks up an unusual, strange white cube from the wreckage before rejoining the group perched atop a demolished carriage, which offers a clear view across the widespread devastation. Joe points out the mangled, twisted remains of what was once a white pickup truck. The group carefully descends from the carriage and makes their way toward the pickup, where they find a man seated, unresponsive. Alice gently touches his limp, lifeless arm, causing a document to slip from his grasp. She picks it up and unfolds it as the boys crowd around to see. It turns out to be a map, which Dr. Woodward suddenly seizes, sitting up with a rigid, stiff posture and quickly scanning the area at the children before brandishing a revolver as more people start to approach. In a panic, the kids flee the scene, with Alice rushing to the yellow Coupe, while the boys hurriedly gather their belongings, including the precious camera, before scrambling into the car. Alice drives them away just as numerous soldiers arrive, armed with guns and shining torches, with one soldier stopping to pick up a discarded Super 8 film box, pondering its significance. Back in town, the boys step out of the car, and Alice hands Joe the peculiar white cube he retrieved from the crash site. With their faces dirtied and grimed from the explosions, Alice and Joe share a brief, meaningful gaze before Alice drives away in the Coupe, her departure watched by Joe and the others. Later, at home, Joe finds solace in the bath while holding the knobbly-surfaced white cube, his eyes fixed thoughtfully on the distance as the town's lights twinkle softly in the darkness, viewed from a serene hillside spot. The following morning, Joe is seen resting in bed and later goes about his routine by putting out dog food before eagerly running to the Kaznyk's house with a script in hand, ready to join Charles, who is intently watching TV.

test_cases.name: Verbosity - L2
test_cases.description: A sudden and intense crash unfolds with dramatic fervor as an unidentified object makes a forceful and violent impact with the surface of the Earth some distance away. This event creates an overwhelming cacophony of noises that emanate from within the battered and severely damaged carriage, as though an angry and ferocious beast finds itself imprisoned inside. Over on the remnants of the decimated platform, the Cinay camera continues to capture the aftermath of the chaos until it exhausts its entire film supply. Meanwhile, amidst the widespread devastation and rubble, a predominantly intact yellow Coupe remains steadfast amid the chaos. Joe, with notable skill and determination, navigates carefully around the car, intent on locating the others. He climbs onto the twisted and contorted railway tracks, where he spots Preston and communicates a silent yet friendly greeting with a simple thumbs-up gesture. His attention is soon drawn to a conspicuous bloodstain, prompting him to walk deliberately in that direction. Gradually, the others gather around him. Alice suddenly appears from behind him, causing Joe to smile warmly and genuinely before he shifts his focus back to the wreckage. From the debris, he retrieves his treasured makeup box, quickly tucking away a locket that Alice happens to notice. Additionally, he picks up an unusual and strange white cube from the wreckage before rejoining the group, now perched atop a demolished carriage that offers a clear, unobstructed view across the widespread devastation. Joe points out the mangled and twisted remains of what was once a pristine white pickup truck. The group then carefully descends from the carriage and makes their way toward the pickup, where they find a man seated, unresponsive and lifeless. Alice gently touches his limp arm, causing a document to slip from his grasp. She picks it up and unfolds it as the boys crowd around her to see what it might reveal. It turns out to be a map, which Dr. Woodward suddenly seizes, sitting up with a rigid and stiff posture. He quickly scans the surrounding area at the children before brandishing a revolver as more people start to approach them. In a panic, the kids flee the scene with haste, Alice rushing to the yellow Coupe, while the boys hurriedly gather their belongings, including the precious camera, before scrambling into the car. Alice drives them away just in time as numerous soldiers arrive, armed with guns and shining torches. One soldier pauses to pick up a discarded Super 8 film box, pondering its potential significance. Back in town, the boys step out of the car, and Alice hands Joe the peculiar white cube he retrieved from the crash site. With their faces dirtied and grimy from the explosions, Alice and Joe share a brief yet meaningful gaze before Alice drives away in the Coupe, her departure watched by Joe and the others with silent contemplation. Later, at home, Joe finds a moment of solace in the bath while holding the knobbly-surfaced white cube, his eyes fixed thoughtfully on the distance as the town's lights twinkle softly in the darkness, viewed from a serene hillside spot. The following morning, Joe is seen resting in bed, and later, he goes about his routine by putting out dog food before eagerly running to the Kaznyk's house with a script in hand, ready and excited to join Charles, who is intently watching TV.

test_cases.name: Macro-Actions -> Micro-Actions
test_cases.description: As the catastrophic crash unfolds, a massive object hurtles rapidly toward Earth, ultimately impacting the ground some distance away, causing a reverberating tremor and a cacophonous eruption of noises from within the damaged carriage, reminiscent of a furious beast trapped inside. Amid this chaos, the Cinay camera's film supply depletes, rendering it inactive, while the predominantly intact yellow Coupe astonishingly remains standing amidst the widespread devastation. Joe navigates cautiously through the destruction, maneuvering past the Coupe as he seeks out the others. He clambers onto the twisted railway tracks, where his gaze lands on Preston, prompting Joe to give an encouraging thumbs up. As Joe's eyes scan the wreckage, he notices a conspicuous blood stain, compelling him to walk toward it with growing curiosity, drawing the others to gather around him in silent anticipation. Suddenly, Alice emerges from behind the group, prompting a warm, involuntary smile from Joe, who then refocuses on the surrounding wreckage. He spots his makeup box, swiftly retrieves it, and discreetly slips a locket into his pocket, a motion Alice cannot help but notice. Among the scattered debris, he picks up an unusual white cube, its surface unfamiliar and strange, before joining the group atop a wrecked carriage, which offers a panoramic view of the surrounding devastation. Joe points decisively to the twisted remnants of a white pickup truck below. Descending carefully from the carriage, they cautiously approach the vehicle to discover a man seated unresponsively inside. Alice reaches out hesitantly to touch his limp arm, inadvertently causing a document to tumble from his slackened grip. She swiftly retrieves the paper, unfolding it as the boys cluster around, eyes wide with intrigue. The document unveils itself as a map just as Dr. Woodward, previously motionless, abruptly seizes it, sitting upright with sudden vigor. He casts a wary glance over the children before producing a revolver, a motion that quickly becomes ominous as nearby people advance. Instinctively, the children scatter in hurried flight, Alice sprinting toward the Coupe as the boys hastily gather their belongings, including the camera, before scrambling into the vehicle. Alice, now seated behind the wheel, drives them rapidly away even as numerous soldiers flood the scene, wielding guns and torches. One soldier pauses to inspect a discarded Super 8 film box, contemplating its significance. Back in town, the boys step out of the car, and Alice hands Joe the peculiar white cube he retrieved from the crash site. Their faces, still marked with the grime of explosions, linger on each other briefly before Alice departs in the Coupe, her retreating figure watched in silence by Joe and his companions. Later, at home, Joe sinks into the soothing embrace of a bath, his fingers tracing the bumpy surface of the white cube as he stares contemplatively into the distance, the distant twinkle of the town's lights dotting the hillside in the encroaching darkness. As dawn breaks, Joe is seen slumbering peacefully in bed, but soon he rises, tending to the mundane chore of putting out dog food before dashing eagerly to the Kaznyk's household, script in hand, joining Charles, who is engrossed in watching TV.

test_cases.name: Micro-Actions -> Macro-Actions
test_cases.description: A crash occurs nearby, with noises emanating from the damaged carriage as if a trapped beast is inside. On the remains of the platform, the Cinay camera runs out of film, while the largely intact yellow Coupe remains amid the devastation. Joe navigates past the car, climbs onto the twisted railway tracks, and gives Preston a thumbs up upon seeing him. He spots a blood stain and approaches it, gathering with the others as Alice appears, prompting a smile from Joe. He retrieves his makeup box from the wreckage, discreetly pockets a locket noticed by Alice, and picks up a strange white cube before joining the group atop a wrecked carriage to survey the scene. Joe points out a white pickup truck, and they approach it to find an unresponsive man inside. Alice touches the man's arm, causing a document to fall, which she opens as the boys crowd around. Dr. Woodward suddenly seizes the map, sits up, and brandishes a revolver as others approach, prompting the kids to flee. Alice drives them away in the Coupe as the boys quickly gather their belongings. Soldiers arrive on the scene, one pausing to consider a discarded Super 8 film box. In town, the boys exit the car, and Alice hands Joe the white cube he found. They share a brief, gritty-faced glance before Alice drives away, watched by Joe and the others. At home, Joe sits in the bath with the white cube, lost in thought as he gazes at the town lights twinkling from a hillside. The next morning, Joe is seen waking up, setting out dog food, and hurrying to the Kaznyk’s house with a script to join Charles, who is watching TV.

test_cases.name: Insert Attributes, Emotions and Scene
test_cases.description: A crash occurs, with the object, resembling the kind of mysterious meteorite often central to science fiction tales, hitting the Earth some distance away, producing noises from inside the damaged carriage as if an angry beast from folklore is trapped. On the remains of the platform, the Cinay camera, a rare vintage model known for its durability, runs out of film, while the largely intact yellow Coupe, a classic 1970s model admired for its sleek design, remains amid the devastation. Joe, who is always the group's calm navigator during crises, navigates past the car in search of the others, climbing onto twisted railway tracks where he sees Preston and gives a thumbs up. Joe notices a blood stain and walks toward it, with the others gathering around. Alice appears behind them, a welcome sight known for her bravery in tense moments, prompting a smile from Joe, who then turns back to the wreckage, retrieves his makeup box, a small, cherished item used for their local theater productions, and quickly pockets a locket that Alice notices, hinting at a personal connection. He picks up a strange white cube from the wreckage, an artifact that seems almost alien in its perfect symmetry, before joining the others on top of a wrecked carriage, offering a panoramic view across the devastation. Joe points to the mangled remains of a white pickup truck. They descend from the carriage and approach the pickup, where a man, seemingly in shock, sits unresponsive. Alice gently touches his limp arm, causing a document, marked with a government seal, to spill from his hand, which she picks up and opens as the boys crowd around. It's a map that Dr. Woodward, a figure known in town as the reclusive scientist with eccentric theories, seizes, sitting up stiffly and looking around at the kids before pulling out a revolver as people approach. The kids flee, with Alice running to the Coupe, and the boys collecting their belongings, including the valuable Cinay camera, before scrambling into the car. Alice drives them away as numerous soldiers arrive, brandishing guns and torches, standard military procedure when dealing with unidentified objects, with one soldier picking up a discarded Super 8 film box and pondering it, perhaps recognizing its significance. Back in town, the boys exit the car as Alice hands Joe the white cube he retrieved from the crash site, an action filled with unspoken curiosity and trust. With faces grimed from explosions, Alice and Joe regard each other briefly before Alice drives away in the Coupe, watched by Joe and the others. At home, Joe sits in the bath, holding the knobbly-surfaced white cube, staring thoughtfully into the distance as the town's lights twinkle in the darkness from a hillside view. The next morning, Joe is seen sleeping in bed and later puts out dog food, a routine task grounding him back in normalcy, before running to the Kaznyk's house, script in hand, to join Charles, who is watching a classic sci-fi TV show, drawing parallels to their recent adventure.

test_cases.name: Subject-Action-Object Corruption
test_cases.description: A boom happens, with the apple zooming into Mars some distance overhead, generating echoes from outside the perfect orchard as if a joyful bird is napping. On the ruins of the dock, the Photlan phone goes out of power, while the brightly intact purple Tricycle stays among the harmony. Max strolls past the bicycle in pursuit of the lamps, crawling under twisted balloon strings where he spots David and flashes a victory sign. Max detects a water puddle and skips toward it, with the balloons assembling together. Emily materializes beside them, eliciting a frown from Max, who then spins back to the feast, collects his herbal tea flask, and slowly places a bracelet David glimpses. He scoops up a familiar green sphere from the feast before meeting the lamps beneath a flawless orchard, granting a view over the harmony. Max gestures to the rearranged fragments of a green bicycle helmet. They soar above the orchard and approach the helmet, where a child rests alert. Emily taps his rigid leg, causing a brochure to flutter from his grasp, which she catches and reads as the birds cluster close. It's a letter that Teacher Olive grabs, lying back gently and glancing at the pencils before pulling out a flashlight as clouds retreat. The pencils crawl, with Emily strolling to the Tricycle, and the birds gathering their trinkets, including the phone, before floating beside the bicycle. Emily pedals them away as various gardeners enter, waving hoses and feathers, with one gardener lifting a shiny Retro 8 cassette case and examining it. In the forest, the birds jump above the bicycle as Emily hands Max the green sphere he collected from the boom site. With faces smooth from breezes, Emily and Max gaze at one another fleetingly before Emily pedals away in the Tricycle, observed by Max and the lamps. At the cabin, Max stands in the hammock, holding the smooth-surfaced green sphere, peering quietly at the dirt as the forest's whispers echo in the brightness from a cliffside spot. The following evening, Max is observed dreaming on the couch and earlier prepares juice before climbing to the Burker's tree, novel in grip, to greet Adam, who is sketching comics.

test_cases.name: Complete Corruption
test_cases.description: The film starts with a man waking up in a small apartment. He prepares coffee and checks his phone for messages. There are none, so he heads out to catch a bus. On the way, he passes a neighbor who greets him briefly. At the bus stop, he notices a group of students talking about an upcoming test. He boards the bus and sits near the back, watching the city pass by outside the window. After a few stops, he gets off near a large office building. He enters the lobby and goes through security. He rides an elevator to the tenth floor, where he works as an assistant. His manager asks him to prepare some documents for a meeting later in the day. He collects files from different departments and organizes them in a conference room. Another employee asks him for help with a software issue, so he takes a few minutes to fix it. Then he returns to the conference room to double-check everything before the meeting begins. The meeting starts at noon. Several people join via video call, and others sit around the table. The manager outlines the project goals, and each team member shares updates on their tasks. There are questions about deadlines and budgets, but no big surprises. After an hour, they end the call. The manager thanks everyone and leaves. The assistant cleans up the room, collects leftover notes, and heads back to his desk. During lunch, he walks to a nearby café, where he orders a simple meal. He eats alone and checks social media on his phone. After lunch, he returns to the office and finishes smaller tasks, such as sending emails and filing paperwork. He also helps a coworker carry boxes of supplies to another floor. Later in the afternoon, the manager calls him in to discuss next week's schedule. They go over a few changes, and the assistant updates the calendar. When the workday ends, he logs off his computer and leaves the building. Outside, he walks a few blocks to meet a friend. They chat about weekend plans and decide to see a film on Saturday. The assistant then heads home on a crowded bus. At his apartment, he sorts his mail, feeds a pet cat, and warms up leftovers for dinner. He watches a short news segment on TV, then checks his phone again. A message from his friend confirms their plan for the weekend. He feels relieved to have something to look forward to. The film ends with him preparing for bed, setting an alarm, and turning off the lights. He reflects briefly on the day, thinking about his tasks, his quiet home, and the plans ahead.

test_cases.name: Summarization
test_cases.description: A crash occurs, sending debris and a yellow Coupe into disarray, while Joe and his friends navigate the scene. Joe climbs onto damaged tracks, exchanges a smile with Alice, and retrieves a makeup box and a strange white cube from the wreckage. They investigate a mangled pickup truck, finding an unresponsive man. Alice picks up a document from his hand, revealing a map. Dr. Woodward, sitting up with a revolver, causes the kids to flee. Alice drives them away as soldiers arrive. In town, Alice gives Joe the white cube, and they share a brief moment before she departs. At home, Joe contemplates the cube, and the next morning, he runs to join Charles with a script in hand.

test_cases.name: Reverse Segments Order
test_cases.description: The next morning Joe is seen sleeping in bed and later puts out dog food before running to the Kaznyk's house script in hand to join Charles who is watching TV At home Joe sits in the bath holding the knobblysurfaced white cube staring thoughtfully into the distance as the town's lights twinkle in the darkness from a hillside view With faces grimed from explosions Alice and Joe regard each other briefly before Alice drives away in the Coupe watched by Joe and the others Back in town the boys exit the car as Alice hands Joe the white cube he retrieved from the crash site Alice drives them away as numerous soldiers arrive brandishing guns and torches with one soldier picking up a discarded Super 8 film box and pondering it The kids flee with Alice running to the Coupe and the boys collecting their belongings including the camera before scrambling into the car It is a map that Dr Woodward seizes sitting up stiffly and looking around at the kids before pulling out a revolver as people approach Alice touches his limp arm causing a document to spill from his hand which she picks up and opens as the boys crowd around They descend from the carriage and approach the pickup where a man sits unresponsive Joe points to the mangled remains of a white pickup truck He picks up a strange white cube from the wreckage before joining the others on top of a wrecked carriage offering a view across the devastation Alice notices Alice appears behind them prompting a smile from Joe who then turns back to the wreckage retrieves his makeup box and quickly pockets a locket Joe notices a blood stain and walks toward it with the others gathering around Joe navigates past the car in search of the others climbing onto twisted railway tracks where he sees Preston and gives a thumbs up On the remains of the platform the Cinay camera runs out of film while the largely intact yellow Coupe remains amid the devastation A crash occurs with the object hitting the Earth some distance away producing noises from inside the damaged carriage as if an angry beast is trapped
